text:
You ignore most AI agents. So do I.

But this one saves me 20 mins every day.

Let me show you how in <4 minutes:

1. Go to Zapier (sign up for free).
2. Visit agents. zapier. com.
3. Click “New Agent” (top right).
4. Prompt "Describe your workflow" like ChatGPT.
5. Copy-paste my prompt to find & summarize the new AI research papers:

Prompt: 

"Browse to [arxiv website for AI papers]. You must screenshot the website multiple times to collect at least 50 research papers total.

Scan through the paper titles and abstracts on the page to identify the 5 best articles. Prioritize articles that help people get better at prompting LLMs. Examples of relevant topics include chain-of-thought prompting techniques, being rude to ChatGPT for better responses, prompt engineering strategies, and practical prompting tips. Avoid articles focused on helping researchers build better LLMs. You successfully teach non-technical users of LLMs to get better at prompt engineering. You do not help researchers.

Extract the arXiv ID (format like arXiv:2511.20627) of the selected 5 papers (out of 50).

Navigate to arxiv [extracted arXiv ID] to access the full paper.

Analyze the full paper abstract and title content and create a comprehensive summary for each paper. The summary should be a summary analysis highlighting relevance to ChatGPT prompting, including main findings, how it applies to prompting, and practical takeaways for users, and most importantly, the surprising aspect of this paper.

Here is a perfect example of a summary:

[example]

For each selected paper, collect:
- Paper Title 
- Summary (summary with ChatGPT prompting relevance, main findings, application to prompting, and practical takeaways)
- Direct Link (format: link[arXiv ID])

Add all collected papers to Google Sheets with columns for Paper Title, Summary, and Direct Link. :action[Google Sheets]

Send ONE single Slack message containing all 5 papers in a numbered list format. The message should start with "Daily AI paper suggestions are ready!" followed by each paper formatted as:

1. Title: [Paper Name]
arXiv link: [arXiv ID]
Why it matters: [summary about the paper and its surprising aspect to prompt LLMs better for non-technical users].

Continue until getting 5.

Use: action[Slack] to send me the message

Final Goal: Collect exactly 5 relevant AI research papers focused on ChatGPT prompting techniques, save them to Google Sheets, and notify the team via Slack with ONE single message containing all 5 papers in numbered list format with bold field names, indented information."
—
☑ Make sure you have credits. It costs just a few cents a day. ☑ I get a Slack message and an updated Excel file with the results.

6. Turn your agent on. 
7. Make sure to have credits.
8. I receive a Slack message + updated Excel.

9. Help others.
